intro: Calendula echinata, commonly known as the spiked marigold, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow to orange flowers with a distinctive spiky center. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Its flowers bloom from late spring to early autumn, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Calendula echinata is often used in herbal remedies and as a decorative plant in gardens.
